alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Greene; Oconee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 8:09PM EST until January 08 at 3:46AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Penfield affecting Oconee, Greene and Clarke Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Between 15 and 17 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand into fields...woodlands and pastures near the river. The water level is very close to Ward Road on the right bank. Flood waters will be approaching irrigation systems and they may need to be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 16.7 feet and rising slowly. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM EST Friday was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.8 feet on 03/08/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
